content.prompt: The statue of Augustus of Prima Porta is most similar to which of the following works?

choices.label: Doryphoros (Spear Bearer), because of its idealized proportions and contrapposto
Winged Victory of Samothrace, because of its heroic scale and dynamic lines
Anavysos Kouros, because of its Archaic smile and idealized nude male form
The statue of Apollo from the Temple of Minerva, because of its energetic stride and patterned drapery

topic.text: 2.1: Cultural Contexts of Ancient Mediterranean Art

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe similarities and/or differences in two or more works of art using appropriate and relevant points of comparison.
